repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Upatēcakāṇṭam is the seventh Kāṇṭam of the Kantapurāṇam, written by Kōṉēriyappar (15th century?) as a supplement to the the Kantapurāṇam of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār. There is another version by Ñāṉavarōtayar (15th century?).
The text is complete. There is no text discontinuity between U3a, f73v and f104r, only a foliation discontinuity. The total stanzas is 4333 (U3b, f273r8).

Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, invocation page, marginal title, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statements, in-text intermediate total stanzas, text total stanzas, colophon, notes (calculations?).

filiation.p: GOML D. 538–539 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, pp. 517–518.); TMSSML cat. n° 451ff. (see Olaganatha Pillay 1925, pp. 361ff.).

supportDesc.condition: Palm-leaf. Relatively good state of preservation, in spite of many bore holes caused by insects.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Verso blank. Shelfmark. Hand #1.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Used as notebook by later hands: notes (calculations?) by later hands. Tamil numerals arranged in a table of the recto. Series of Tamil numerals on the verso.
244 folios = Upatēcakāṇṭam. Tamil foliation [1]–73 (f1 not explicitly foliated) and 104-273. Hand #2. 8 to 9 lines per page.

1 folio = Upatēcakāṇṭam: Invocation. No foliation.
U3a: 1 folio, unfoliated = invocation page, by hand n° 2.
243 folios = Upatēcakāṇṭam: Mūlam. Tamil foliation 2–73 and 104-273.

additions.desc: Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink: 445 crossed-out in red by a later hand.
Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written313 (in red; crossed-out in blue by a later hand) & 337 (in blue).

origin.origDate: The date provided in a year of the Jovian cycle in the colophon (U3b, f273rv) cannot be ascertained since at least one of its calendrical elements is wrong. Possible (and plausible, since the MS was part of Ariel's bequest made to the Société Asiatique in 1855) conversions in the Gregorian are: 1656, 1716, 1776 and 1836. The appearance of the MS makes 1716 and 1776 the most plausible dates. For further details, see Ciotti & Franceschini (forthcoming). Cabaton (1912, p. 49) dates the manuscript to 1732, on unstated grounds.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Edouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Edouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).
